Package be.projet3.toutouapp.controllers

Class UserController

java.lang.Object
be.projet3.toutouapp.controllers.UserController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/user") public class UserController extends Object
REST controller for managing users. Provides endpoints for CRUD operations, user activation/deactivation, and role management.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • getActiveUsers

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<User>> getActiveUsers()
      Retrieves all active users.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing a list of active users and HTTP status 200 (OK).

    • addUser

      @PostMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<User> addUser(@RequestBody User user)
      Adds a new user.
      Parameters:
      user - the User object to be created.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the created User and HTTP status: - 201 (Created) if successful, - 400 (Bad Request) if there is an error in the request.

    • updateUser

      @PutMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<User> updateUser(@PathVariable int id, @RequestBody User user)
      Updates an existing user by ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the user to be updated.
      user - the User object containing updated details.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the updated User and HTTP status: - 200 (OK) if successful, - 404 (Not Found) if the user does not exist, - 500 (Internal Server Error) for unexpected errors.

    • deleteUser

      @DeleteMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> deleteUser(@PathVariable int id)
      Deletes a user by their ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the user to be deleted.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with HTTP status: - 204 (No Content) if deletion is successful, - 404 (Not Found) if the user does not exist, - 500 (Internal Server Error) for unexpected errors.

    • createUserFromToken

      @PostMapping("/create") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<User> createUserFromToken(org.springframework.security.oauth2.server.resource.authentication.JwtAuthenticationToken token)
      Creates a user from the given authentication token.
      Parameters:
      token - the JwtAuthenticationToken containing user information.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the created User and HTTP status 200 (OK).

    • getAllEmails

      @GetMapping("/emails") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<String>> getAllEmails()
      Retrieves all user emails.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing a list of email strings and HTTP status 200 (OK).

    • getUserByEmail

      @GetMapping("/{email}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<User> getUserByEmail(@PathVariable String email)
      Retrieves a user by their email.
      Parameters:
      email - the email of the user to retrieve.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the User and HTTP status: - 200 (OK) if the user is found, - 404 (Not Found) if the user does not exist.

    • blockUser

      @PatchMapping("/{id}/block") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> blockUser(@PathVariable int id, @RequestParam boolean block)
      Blocks or unblocks a user.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the user to block/unblock.
      block - the boolean flag indicating whether to block (true) or unblock (false) the user.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the updated User and HTTP status: - 200 (OK) if successful, - 400 (Bad Request) if blocking is not allowed or other issues occur.

    • updateUserFlag

      @PatchMapping("/{id}/flag") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updateUserFlag(@PathVariable int id, @RequestParam boolean flag)
      Activates or deactivates a user.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the user to activate/deactivate.
      flag - the boolean flag indicating whether to activate (true) or deactivate (false) the user.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the updated User and HTTP status: - 200 (OK) if successful, - 400 (Bad Request) if deactivation is not allowed or other issues occur.
